channel.title: 7 - QoS Plugin Module on Apache Dubbo
channel.description: Recent content in 7 - QoS Plugin Module on Apache Dubbo

item.title: 7-1 - QOS is Closed
item.description:
Possible Causes

QOS is Closed

Troubleshooting and Resolution Steps

Please refer to the QOS Operation Manual.

item.title: 7-2 - QOS is enabled
item.description:
Possible Reasons

QOS is enabled and is set to on by default.

Troubleshooting and Resolution Steps

Please refer to the QOS Operation Manual.

item.title: 7-3 - Set the warning percentage value for timeout
item.description:
Possible Reasons

QOS sets the warning percentage value for timeout, which defaults to 0.75. After modification, this message will be printed in the console.

Troubleshooting and Resolution Steps

Please refer to the QOS operation manual Performance Sampling Command.

item.title: 7-4 - QOS Service Startup Failure
item.description:
Possible Causes

The QOS parameter values are not set correctly. The main parameters are qos.host and qos.port.

Troubleshooting and Resolution Steps

Please refer to the QOS operation manual QOS Overview.

item.title: 7-5 - QOS command not found
item.description:
Possible Causes

The QOS command is misspelled.

Troubleshooting and Resolution Steps

The QOS command does not exist.

Please refer to the QOS operation manual Basic Command Manual for more information.

item.title: 7-6 - QOS encountered an unknown exception
item.description:
Possible Causes

QOS encountered an unknown exception

Troubleshooting and Resolution Steps

  1. Check whether the service for the current request is accessible.
  2. It is possible that for some reason, the CommandContext instance could not be loaded or returned correctly. You can troubleshoot and locate the issue based on the error messages in the console.

item.title: 7-7 - QOS Unauthorized Access
item.description:
Possible Causes

The QoS request is unauthorized to access the corresponding resource, which typically occurs in scenarios of malicious attacks.

Troubleshooting and Resolution Steps

Check if the request is expected. If not expected, check for any sources of malicious attacks.

If it is expected, please refer to the article on QoS Security to configure the corresponding permission information.
